intro: Bulbine hantamensis, commonly known as the Hantam bulbous, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, rounded bulbs that store water and nutrients, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Bulbine hantamensis is often found in the Western and Northern Cape provinces of South Africa.
